critique: The executive order aims to address drug use among federal employees. It expresses concern about the adverse effects of drug use on productivity, public safety, and national security. The order seeks to establish a drug-free workplace through testing, counseling, and disciplinary actions. The intended emotions are primarily fear (of consequences for drug use), disgust (towards drug use), and a degree of hope (through rehabilitation programs). There might be a touch of surprise at the extent of the measures being taken. Joy and sadness are not primary emotions the order intends to evoke.
